data.title: 21 Aircraft Engine Manufacturing Companies Scaling Heights
data.meta_description: Discover the top 21 aircraft engine manufacturing companies revolutionizing the aviation sector. This in-depth look at industry giants like Safran and Pratt & Whitney offers a closer understanding of their innovative contributions
data.text:
The aircraft engine manufacturing industry is comprised of various global corporations that develop innovative and sophisticated engines for different types of aircraft. These companies provide a multitude of products and services, which include a variety of engine models, maintenance, repair, and overhaul solutions tailored for military, commercial, and private aviation. As an industry that is rooted in engineering and technology, the trends are directed towards producing cleaner, more efficient, and economical power solutions, to meet the evolving demands of air travel and the growing emphasis on reducing carbon emissions.

Top 21 Aircraft Engine Manufacturing Companies

1. Safran

Website: safran-group.com

Headquarters: Paris, Washington, France

Founded: 2005

Headcount: 10001+

Latest funding type: Ipo

LinkedIn

Safran Group is a global company that specializes in aerospace and defense technologies. They offer a wide range of products and services in areas such as aircraft engines, electrical systems, landing systems, and more. With a presence in 27 countries, Safran Group is known for its innovation and commitment to sustainability.

2. Pratt & Whitney

Website: prattwhitney.com

Headquarters: East Hartford, Connecticut, United States

Headcount: 10001+

LinkedIn

Pratt & Whitney is an engineering company that offers maintenance, repair, and overhaul solutions for aviation engines. They provide a range of products and services for commercial, business, and military aviation customers.

3. Rolls-Royce

Website: rolls-royce.com

Headquarters: London, England, United Kingdom

Founded: 1906

Headcount: 10001+

Latest funding type: Post Ipo Equity

LinkedIn

Rolls-Royce is a leading company in the aerospace industry, specializing in the development and manufacturing of cutting-edge technologies for clean, safe, and competitive power solutions. They provide innovative solutions to meet the world's vital power needs.

4. MTU Aero Engines

Website: mtu.de

Headquarters: MÃ¼nchen, Bayern, Germany

Founded: 1913

Headcount: 10001+

Latest funding type: Ipo

LinkedIn

MTU Aero Engines is a company that specializes in the production, maintenance, and development of aircraft engines. They are committed to sustainability and have set global goals for 2025+ in line with the UN's sustainable development goals. MTU Aero Engines strives to reduce emissions, conserve resources, and ensure product quality and flight safety. They actively engage in stakeholder dialogue and uphold human rights in their supply chain.

5. CFM International (CFM)

Website: cfmaeroengines.com

Headquarters: Cincinnati, Ohio, United States

Founded: 1974

Headcount: 10001+

LinkedIn

CFM Aero Engines is a leading supplier of jet engines for single-aisle aircraft. They offer a range of engines including the LEAP and CFM56, which are known for their cutting-edge technology and unparalleled performance. With a commitment to sustainability, CFM provides services such as maintenance, materials support, and asset support to help keep their customers flying.

6. GE Aerospace

Website: geaviation.com

Headquarters: Cincinnati, Ohio, United States

Founded: 1894

Headcount: 10001+

Latest funding type: Grant

LinkedIn

GE Aviation is a leading provider of jet and turboprop engines, as well as integrated systems for commercial, military, business, and general aviation aircraft. They offer through-life support, open architecture solutions, electrification, avionics, electrical power integration, propeller systems, gas turbine components, software solutions, and marine systems.

7. ITP Aero

Website: itpaero.com

Headquarters: Zamudio, Vizcaya, Spain

Founded: 1989

Headcount: 1001-5000

Latest funding type: Acquired

LinkedIn

ITP Aero is an aerospace company specializing in the manufacturing and servicing of engines, turbines, and other aeronautical components. They offer a wide range of products and services to the commercial aviation, business aviation, and defense sectors. With a focus on innovation and sustainability, ITP Aero aims to drive the aerospace industry towards a more sustainable future.

8. MinebeaMitsumi Aerospace

Website: minebeamitsumi-aerospace.com

Headquarters: Peterborough, New Hampshire, United States

Founded: 1951

Headcount: 10001+

LinkedIn

MinebeaMitsumi Aerospace is a global brand specializing in the design, manufacture, and supply of high-precision components and solutions for sophisticated aircraft platforms. With expertise in additive manufacturing, advanced bearing and mechatronic solutions, and aerospace standards approvals, the company caters to the needs of the aviation industry. Their comprehensive range of products includes ball bearings, bolts and fasteners, machined parts, and rod end and spherical bearings. MinebeaMitsumi Aerospace serves customers worldwide by delivering tailored solutions and leveraging its extensive network of aerospace manufacturers.

9. Sequa Corporation

Website: sequa.com

Headquarters: Palm Beach Gardens, Florida, United States

Founded: 1929

Headcount: 5001-10000

Latest funding type: Acquired

LinkedIn

Sequa is a global technology company and a leading solutions provider for aircraft engines and gas turbines. It delivers integrated solutions designed to reduce costs and extend the life of gas turbine engines. Sequa, along with its subsidiary Chromalloy, has been acquired by Veritas Capital, a leading technology and government investment firm.

10. Enjet Aero

Website: enjetaero.com

Headquarters: Overland Park, Kansas, United States

Headcount: 201-500

LinkedIn

Enjet Aero is a company specializing in the manufacturing of precision machined and fabricated components and assemblies for jet engines. They serve the commercial, defense, and general aviation industries with their broad capabilities and are dedicated to exceeding customer expectations.

11. Engine Alliance

Website: enginealliance.com

Headquarters: Glastonbury, Connecticut, United States

Founded: 1996

Headcount: 51-200

LinkedIn

Engine Alliance is a joint company of General Electric and Pratt & Whitney, specializing in providing the GP7200 engine, the quietest, most reliable, and most economical engine for the A380. They offer a flexible, reliable, and efficient support network to maximize the return on investment for their customers.

12. Famat

Website: famat.fr

Headquarters: SimÃµes, PiauÃ­, France

Headcount: 201-500

LinkedIn

Famat is a company specializing in the industrial manufacture and production of high technology fixed structural components for aircraft engines. It is an equally-owned subsidiary of Safran Aircraft Engines and General Electric, two major players in the aerospace propulsion industry. Their products are used in engines for Airbus and Boeing planes.

13. Advanced Atomization Technologies

Website: advancedatomization.com

Headquarters: Clyde, New York, United States

Founded: 2014

Headcount: 201-500

LinkedIn

Advanced Atomization Technologies is a leading manufacturer of fuel atomization nozzles for aircraft engines. Their advanced nozzle and combustor integration contribute to enhanced power, efficiency, emissions reduction, and noise reduction. They provide design, production, and support for fuel nozzles used in GE, CFM, and Engine Alliance gas turbine engines.

14. Srebot Technologies

Website: srebot.com

Headquarters: Bondoufle, Ile De France, France

Founded: 1973

Headcount: 11-50

LinkedIn

SREBOT Technologies is a leading provider of precision machining and manufacturing services for aircraft and turbine engines. With over 40 years of experience, our highly qualified team specializes in producing large parts for commercial and military aircraft engines. We offer a one-stop speed shop for machining and dedicated production capabilities for medium-large productions.

15. Aeromax Industries Inc.

Website: aeromax.com

Headquarters: Fort Worth, Texas, United States

Founded: 1986

Headcount: 11-50

LinkedIn

Aeromax Industries Inc. is a company based in Fort Worth, Texas, offering parts sourcing solutions, manufacturing, kitting, and engine repair management services. They specialize in engines such as Rolls Royce AE3007, Pratt & Whitney Canada PW100, and GE J85. With certifications and expertise in the aviation industry, they cater to customers in the aerospace sector. Contact them at +1 817 953 8950 or sales@aeromax.com.

16. Southwest Turbine Inc.

Website: southwestturbine.com

Headquarters: Phoenix, Arizona, United States

Founded: 1986

Headcount: 11-50

LinkedIn

Southwest Turbine Inc. (STI) is a recognized leader in new manufacture, repair, overhaul, and re-manufacturing of aircraft gas turbine engine replacement components. With over 35 years of experience, STI offers FAA approved replacement turbine engine parts including Honeywell TPE331, PWC PT6A, PWC PT6T TwinPac, PWC PW100, and Rolls Royce A250. They provide comprehensive services from design and manufacture to repair, overhaul, direct sales, and global distribution. STI is committed to delivering high-quality products and satisfying customer needs in the aviation industry.

17. GKN Aerospace

Website: gknaerospace.com

Headquarters: Solihull, West Midlands, United Kingdom

Founded: 1759

Headcount: 10001+

LinkedIn

GKN Aerospace is a technology leader in smart engine systems, serving the world's leading aircraft and aero-engine manufacturers. With three business lines (civil airframe, defense airframe, and engine systems), GKN Aerospace is shaping the Future of Flight.

18. Aciturri

Website: aciturri.com

Headquarters: Miranda De Ebro, Burgos, Spain

Founded: 1977

Headcount: 1001-5000

LinkedIn

Aciturri is a solid Tier1 global aerostructures and aeroengines supplier, offering a wide range of complex motor products with innovative technology.

19. Singapore Aero Engine Services Private Limited (SAESL)

Website: saesl.com.sg

Headquarters: Singapore, Central Region, Singapore

Founded: 1999

Headcount: 1001-5000

LinkedIn

SAESL is a Trent Centre of Excellence providing best in class aero engine and component repair services for the successful Rolls-Royce Trent engine family. With a customer base spanning across 6 continents, SAESL is the world's largest Trent engine MRO. Committed to servicing the best by the best, SAESL is known for its service excellence.

20. Pem-Air Turbine Engine Services, LLC

Website: pem-airturbine.com

Headquarters: Brooksville, Florida, United States

Founded: 2013

Headcount: 51-200

LinkedIn

Pem-Air Turbine provides high-quality repair and overhaul services for gas turbine engines and related platform components. With extensive capabilities and decades of experience, we specialize in repairing engines such as CFM56, CF6, JT3D/TF33, JT9D, PW2000/F117, PW4000, and supporting aircraft models like Boeing 737, 757, 767, Airbus A300, A310, A318, A319, A320, A321, Bombardier, Gulfstream, Dassault, and Embraer.

21. Hartzell Aerospace Welding (AWI/AMI/Acorn Welding)

Website: hartzellaerospacewelding.com

Headquarters: Eagan, Minnesota, United States

Founded: 2022

Headcount: 201-500

LinkedIn

We are a proud industry leader in welding, bending, and fabricating sheet metal and tubing, as well as the manufacturing, repair, and overhaul of piston aircraft exhaust and engine mounts.

Want to find more aircraft engine manufacturing companies?

If you want to find more companies that produce cutting-edge aircraft engines and provide comprehensive maintenance services you can do so with Inven. This list was built with Inven and there are hundreds of companies like these globally.

With Inven you'll also get to know the company's:

Ownership: Which of these are private equity backed? Which are family-owned?

Contact data: Who are the owners and CEO's? What are their emails and phone numbers?

Financials: How do these companies perform financially? What are their revenues and profit margins?

...and a lot more!
